intro: Escobariopsis jaliscana subsp. zacatecasensis, commonly known as the Zacatecas Escobariopsis, is a rare and endemic species native to the rocky and arid regions of Zacatecas, Mexico. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant typically produces small, spike-like inflorescences with minute, pale green to brownish florets. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
